CreateApp.document: This API is used to create a GME application.
CreateApp.name: Creates a GME application

DeleteRoomMember.document: This API is used to delete a room or remove members from the room.
DeleteRoomMember.name: Deletes a room or removes a member from the room

DescribeAppStatistics.document: This API is used to query the usage statistics of a GME application, including those of Voice Chat, Voice Message Service, Voice Analysis, etc. The maximum query period is the past 30 days.
DescribeAppStatistics.name: Queries application usage statistics

DescribeApplicationData.document: This API is used to query data details for up to the past 90 days.
DescribeApplicationData.name: Queries data details

DescribeRecordInfo.document: This API is used to query a recording task.
DescribeRecordInfo.name: Queries a recording task

DescribeTaskInfo.document: This API is used to query the recording task in a room.
DescribeTaskInfo.name: Queries the recording task in a room

ModifyAppStatus.document: This API is used to change the status of an application.
ModifyAppStatus.name: Changes application status

ModifyRecordInfo.document: This API is used to modify recording configurations.
ModifyRecordInfo.name: Modifies recording configurations

StartRecord.document: This API is used to start recording.
StartRecord.name: Starts recording

StopRecord.document: This API is used to stop recording.
StopRecord.name: Stops recording

members.document:
List of engines to be supported.
Valid values: `android`, `ios`, `unity`, `cocos`, `unreal`, `windows`. All values are selected by default.
members.name: EngineList

members.document:
List of regions.
Valid values: `mainland` (Chinese mainland), `hmt` (Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan (China)), `sea` (Southeast Asia), `na` (North America), `eu` (Europe), `jpkr` (Japan, Korea and Asia Pacific), `sa` (South America), `oc` (Oceania), `me` (Middle East). All values are selected by default.
members.name: RegionList

Information about the recording task in a room.

members.document: User ID. The value is `0` in mixed streams recording mode.
members.name: UserId

members.document: Recording filename.
members.name: FileName

members.document: Recording start time, which is a Unix timestamp. Example: 1234567868.
members.name: RecordBeginTime

members.document: Recording status. Valid values: `2`: recording; `10`: to be transcoded; `11`: transcoding; `12`: uploading; `13`: uploaded; `14`: user notified.
members.name: RecordStatus

members.name: BizId

members.document: Room ID.

members.name: RecordMode

members.name: SubscribeRecordUserIds

members.document: Task ID.
members.name: TaskId

members.document:
Usage of the service (in seconds)
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Data

SubscribeRecordUserIds.document: Allowlist or blocklist for stream subscription.

members.document:
Blocklist for audio subscription. For example, `["1", "2", "3"]` means to not subscribe to the audio streams of users 1, 2, and 3. If this parameter is left empty, the audio streams of all users (max 20) in the room will not be subscribed to.
Note: You cannot specify `UnSubscribeAudioUserIds` and `SubscribeAudioUserIds` at the same time.
members.name: UnSubscribeUserIds

members.document:
Allowlist for audio subscription. For example, `["1", "2", "3"]` means to subscribe to the audio streams of users 1, 2, and 3. If this parameter is left empty, the audio streams of all users (max 20) in the room will be subscribed to.
Note: You cannot specify `UnSubscribeAudioUserIds` and `SubscribeAudioUserIds` at the same time.
members.name: SubscribeUserIds
